An effective cost function formulation is employed, eliminating the need for tuning a weighting factor, which is typically required in conventional approaches. The effectiveness of the proposed method for speed estimation in motoring mode of operation is demonstrated through simulation in MATLAB<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">®</sup>/Simulink and experimentally validated using a 5.5 kW IM drive prototype, the results suggest that proposed scheme is a promising method for sensorless control of IM drive.

title: A Short-Term Passenger Flow Forecasting Algorithm for Airports Based on Improved Back Propagation Neural Network
authors: Jie Zhou, Yilun Zhang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Culture-Oriented Science &amp; Technology (CoST)
abstract: To address the unique patterns of airport passenger flow and the impact of external factors on prediction outcomes, this study introduces an enhanced Back Propagation Neural Network (BNN) algorithm for short-term passenger flow forecasting. The BNN model extracts localized spatial features of passenger distribution across airport zones, while integrated Residual Neural Units (ResNet) augment network depth to enhance predictive precision. Concurrently, Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks are employed to model temporal dependencies within the passenger flow data. The fusion of these approaches yields robust prediction outcomes, enabling accurate short-term passenger flow estimation. Comparative experiments demonstrate that the proposed method outperforms conventional techniques in predicting security checkpoint throughput across diverse time intervals and operational scenarios.

title: Unlocking Industrial Decarbonization: The Imperative of Operational Flexibility
authors: Aaquib Firdous, Chandra Prakash Barala, Parul Mathuria, Rohit Bhakar
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Hydrogen-consuming industries (HCIs) have constrained downstream processes requiring steady operations. Therefore, maintaining Round-the-Clock (RTC) energy availability is eminent while shifting to Hydrogen Electrolyzers (HE) based HCIs powered by variable grids. However, relying on RTC supply from the grid may increase emissions and costs, affecting economics and sustainability. Besides under the current regulations, HCIs must follow Renewable energy (RE) temporal correlations to ensure the hydrogen produced is green. Thus, effective HE operations with suitable HE technology are critical for HCIs with constrained downstream operations. Hydrogen storage (HS) may facilitate partial hydrogen supply for HCIs and ensure RE accommodation at peak times. However, this cannot be accomplished without appropriate operational flexibility in HEs acting as the core for sustainable hydrogen adoption, enabling dynamic load management to align production with fluctuating RE. This well-articulated study advocates the role of model fidelity and operational flexibility in sustainable HCI operations under rigid downstream operations. The proposed aspects enhance compliance with regulations and targets, adjust electricity demand, and minimize grid stress and curtailments. This synergistic approach ensures a path toward decarbonized industrial processes. Further, multiple supply options and limitations for HCIs are discussed to ensure RTC energy availability and reduce emissions and costs.

title: Enhancing Web Security Through Machine Learning-Based Feature Selection for Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Attacks Classification
authors: Charchit Gharai, Sunil Kumar Mohapatra, Somanath Parida, Rajkumar Mohanta, Sujata Chakravarty, Dayal Sankar Ghosh
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks fall under the broad classification of web security vulnerabilities. It enables attackers to inject harmful scripts into trusted sites that compromise sensitive user data and system integrity. The primary objective of our work is to classify cross-scripting attacks to enhance web security. This proposed approach categorizes the XSS attacks into three types of payloads: reflected, stored, and DOM-based. Each entry contains an encoded URL or script that exploits a weakness in web applications. A benchmark dataset is accessed from the IEEE Dataport repository to train, test, and performance analysis of the model. As per the earlier study, the machine learning model plays a crucial role in XSS attack detection and classification. However, these models lack in terms of proper feature selection techniques. So in this research, we have applied the widely used ML algorithms such as Random Forest, Decision tree, Support vector classifier, KNN, and Naive Bayes approach, along with the most preferred feature selection techniques to design the model. The model outcome shows that Random Forest’s testing accuracy is 0.9908 without feature selection. Accordingly, using feature selection techniques for Random Forest, the SelectKBest Chi<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> method achieved an accuracy of 0.8933, while SelectKBest Mutual Information reached 0.9167. Using the wrapper-based approach (RFE), the highest accuracy was 0.9789 with Random Forest, followed by KNN with 0.9433. Then the embedded method resulted in an accuracy of 0.9100. Though the Random Forest model without using feature selection holds the highest testing accuracy, it is suspected to be overfitting. Therefore, feature selection methods are utilized to minimize overfitting and increase the ability of the model to generalize. Therefore, in this research work, we have primarily focused on the feature selection techniques to mitigate this issue.

title: LSTM and CNN based Speech Emotion Recognition a New Paradigm in Deep Learning
authors: G.L.N. Murthy, Ch. Yagnitha, Sk. Nafia, J.Divya Latha
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: Identifying the emotions hidden in speech (SER) encounters difficulties in virtue of the subjective and variable nature of human emotions, along with limitations such as data dependency, biases from training data, and a restricted range of emotion categories. Machine learning-based SER employs algorithms to classify emotional content in spoken language, with deep learning methods, notably LSTM-RNNs, gaining traction for their adeptness in capturing temporal dependencies in audio data. Despite this, they still confront issues like data dependency and inherited biases. To mitigate these limitations, a hybrid algorithm comprising LSTM-RNNs to address the drawbacks of existing SER algorithms. By focusing on temporal interdependencies, LSTM-RNNs offer a remedy to the vanishing gradient problem inherent in long-range dependencies. The proposed system with an accuracy of 96.34 %, seeks to overcome these shortcomings, presenting a more robust and precise method for SER, promising advancements in human-computer interaction, healthcare, security, and entertainment sectors.

title: An Innovative Design Framework for the Manchu Cultural Industry Driven by Digital Twin Technology
authors: Yuxin Zhao, Nuo Pang, Linlin Ge
publish: 2025 International Conference on Culture-Oriented Science &amp; Technology (CoST)
abstract: With the rapid development of digital technology, digital twin technology, as a new technical means, is bringing new opportunities for the development of cultural industry. As an important part of traditional Chinese culture, Manchu culture is rich in historical and cultural resources. However, in the digital age, the Manchu cultural industry is facing the dual challenges of inheritance and innovation. Based on digital twin technology, this paper discusses its application in Manchu cultural industry, and puts forward the innovation design of Manchu cultural industry driven by digital twin. By constructing the digital twin model of Manchu culture, the digital protection, inheritance and innovation of culture can be realized, and the sustainable development of Manchu culture industry in the Internet era can be promoted.

title: Coverage-Driven Verification of Ethernet MAC Using System Verilog and UVM
authors: Beulah Grace Nelam, P. Sharmila, D.P.S. Praveenya, N. Vedajhna, N.V.S. Nagalakshmi, G. Gayathri, M. Durga Prakash
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: In modern high-speed networking systems, the Ethernet MAC layer is essential for ensuring dependable and high-performance data transfer across network systems. This project presents the design and functional verification of an Ethernet MAC module, focusing on compliance with the IEEE 802. 3 standard. The verification environment was developed using SystemVerilog and Universal Verification Methodology (UVM), ensuring a modular, reusable, and scalable platform for constrained-random and coverage-driven verification. The environment incorporates key UVM components such as interface, transaction, driver, monitor, agent, scoreboard, and environment. A master-slave interface was created to facilitate MIIM (Management Interface) register access, supporting both read and write operations. To simulate physical layer communication, a PHY interface was implemented, and the MII (Media Independent Interface) was used to manage data exchange between the MAC and PHY layers. The testbench supported a range of test scenarios, including TX data path, RX data path, MIIM register write, MIIM register read, and PHY clock variation. Functional coverage metrics were captured to ensure verification completeness, and a scoreboard was employed for data comparison and result validation. This project delivers a robust and reusable verification environment tailored specifically for validating the Ethernet MAC design.

title: Size-Based Sorting Yeast Cells Separation via Optically Induced Dielectrophoretic Virtual Channel
authors: Yongqi Hu, Ying Wang, Tiantian Li, Weida Zhan, Rui Yan, Wenzhuang Zhai, Rongjiu Wei, Zuobin Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Manipulation, Manufacturing and Measurement on the Nanoscale (3M-NANO)
abstract: This study proposes a size-based yeast cells sorting method utilizing optically induced dielectrophoresis (ODEP) virtual channel. By dynamically modulating light patterns (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$3 \text{kHz}, 3 ~\mathrm{V}$</tex>) and leveraging the differences in dielectrophoretic forces experienced by cells of varying sizes, non-contact virtual channels were constructed on-chip to achieve label-free and precise yeast cells sorting. Experimental results demonstrated that larger cells (average equivalent spherical diameter, ESD <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$8.45 \mu ~\mathrm{m}$</tex>) experienced stronger dielectrophoretic forces. After being captured by the light patterns, they were able to move following the displacement of the light patterns. In contrast, smaller cells (ESD <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$6.72 \mu ~\mathrm{m}$</tex>) experienced weaker dielectrophoretic forces. After being captured by the light patterns, their movement speed lagged behind the moving speed of the light patterns. Ultimately, the differing dielectrophoretic forces resulted in the gradual separation of cells by size. Compared to traditional physical channels or fluorescence labeling methods, this approach avoids chemical damage and allows real-time adjustment of channel parameters. The study confirms the high sensitivity and reliability of ODEP virtual channel technology in eukaryotic microorganism sorting, providing a versatile platform for single-cell analysis.

title: Explainable AI and Edge AI Integration for Hand Gesture Recognition in Industrial Robotics
authors: Emilija Ćojbašić, Dragan Stojanović, Dejan Rančić, Natalija Stojanović, Žarko Ćojbašić
abstract: The integration of Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) and Edge Artificial Intelligence has been investigated to enhance transparency and trust in intelligent systems for industrial robotics. A real-time hand gesture recognition system has been implemented using the YOLO deep learning model on the resource-constrained NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano platform. To address the need for interpretability, several XAI techniques-SHAP, LIME, and Grad-CAM-have been applied to analyze and visualize decision-making process of the model. Performance and resource utilization metrics have been collected for each XAI method to evaluate trade-offs between interpretability and system efficiency. The limitations imposed by the edge hardware have been identified as a critical factor affecting the feasibility of real-time explanations. Wider conclusions have been devised and future research directions outlined. The study demonstrated the practical viability of deploying interpretable AI models on edge devices, contributing toward more transparent and interactive human-robot collaboration in industrial settings.

title: Enhancing Image Restoration with Quantum-Integrated Contrastive Adversarial Networks
authors: Satvik Raghav, Sathwik Narkedimilli, Sathwik Reddy Majji, Msvpj Sathvik
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: This study presents an advanced image enhancement model that synergistically combines contrastive adversarial networks (CANs) with quantum computing capabilities through quantum neural networks (QNNs) utilizing CUDA-Q. This innovative framework addresses the limitations of traditional image restoration techniques by employing quantum-enhanced feature extraction to capture intricate details within images. Furthermore, it leverages adversarial learning augmented by contrastive loss to yield high-quality restorations. Our model was evaluated on 50 random photos from the CIFAR-10 dataset, achieving an average Structural Similarity Index Measure (SSIM) of 0.8873 and a Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio (PSNR) of 22.5981. These results demonstrate significant enhancements over noisy baselines, with statistically significant t-test findings $(p\lt 0.0001)$. Integrating CUDA-Q accelerates computational efficiency, thereby reducing processing times while improving the model’s capability to reconstruct fine details. This research highlights the transformative potential of quantum-enhanced machine learning in image restoration, laying the groundwork for future advancements in quantum-assisted computer vision.

title: Analysis of Martingale Strategy in Quantitative Trading Market Based on BiLSTM-Attention Model
authors: Zhaohan Hou
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: In order to overcome the shortcomings of the traditional Martingale Strategy in the extreme market, such as the poor adaptability of the margin call and the fixed position adding mechanism, this study proposes an improved Martingale Strategy combining the BiLSTM-Attention model and the multi-dimensional dynamic management mechanism. By constructing a quantitative framework including data processing, time series prediction, strategy implementation and back testing evaluation, the BiLSTM-Attention model is used to capture the long-term time series dependence of Kweichow Moutai (600519) stock price, and generate price prediction signals for future trading days; It also designs a composite signal system, integrates RSI, MACD, volatility indicators and dynamic position management module, introduces multiple risk barriers, index gradient position adding mechanism and sliding window profit and loss stop strategy, and realizes risk adaptive control. The results of the back test show that in the extreme market from June to September 2024, the traditional Martingale Strategy has suffered a large loss, while the improved Martingale Strategy has avoided the loss caused by large-scale overweight by virtue of multi-dimensional technical indicators. The improved Martingale Strategy significantly reduces the loss risk in the trend market by filtering invalid signals through technical indicators, adjusting position size through volatility and active profit and loss stop mechanism, and verifies the effectiveness of the collaborative optimization of the deep learning model and traditional trading strategies. This framework provides an extensible technical path for low-frequency quantitative trading, and is suitable for personal lightweight financial product development.

title: Remnant Life Estimation of High-Voltage Transformers using TOPSIS
authors: Mulpuru Gopi, Chilaka Ranga, Kushal M Japtap
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: Remanent life estimation of power transformers plays a critical role in condition monitoring and insights into how long the transformer has been in service. The transformer is subjected to multiple stresses, such as thermal, electrical, ambient, etc., leading to degradation of the insulation, causing sudden failures. It is really quite difficult to estimate the real age or real life of the transformers. In the present paper, a novel technique for order preference by similarity to the ideal solution (TOPSIS) method is used to estimate the remaining life of the high-voltage power transformers. This method focused on calculating the percentage of available degradation and corresponding to its ranking. The proposed method is validated with 9 diagnostics attributes that significantly affect the life of the transformers that have been taken into consideration. Onfiled data collected from 15 transformers with their pre-known age taken from Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board, India, is used. All the data is normalized within a linear range to maintain consistency and comparability. The proposed approach successfully addresses all the limitations of traditional estimated methods. The proposed method introduced the new basement for life estimation of transformers. This technique is beneficial for diagnostic experts and the power industry for properly estimating the life of the transformers. This work is beneficial for timely taking decisions on maintenance, management and replacement of the asset.

title: Multi-scale MEG Channel Selection and Schizophrenia Recognition
authors: Wenjun Zhang, Xiaoxia Huang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: To reduce the dimensionality of magnetoencephalography (MEG) data, this paper proposes a multi-scale channel selection method that integrates frequency-domain and time-frequency analysis. First, 50 discriminative channels are selected using Fisher discriminant ratio based on power spectral density and frequency band ratio features. Subsequently, wavelet transform is applied to extract time-frequency features, and the Fisher discriminant ratio is employed again to optimize the selection to 30 optimal channels. Results demonstrate that the selected channels are primarily distributed in frontal and temporal lobes, with significant differences between groups observed in theta band energy mean and complexity mean. Classification using these two features achieves an accuracy of 74.3%. These findings are consistent with neuropathological research and show promising clinical application potential. This study validates the effectiveness of the multi-scale MEG channel selection strategy and provides new insights for constructing lightweight objective assessment models.

title: Research on recommendation system algorithm based on graph neural network
authors: Yue Xiao, Minyi Wen, Shan Lu
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: In this paper, an intelligent cooperative optimization model of supply chain based on multi-modal graph neural network is proposed to improve the cooperative efficiency and response ability of supply chain under dynamic environment. By combining graph neural networks (GNN) and multimodal learning, the model can effectively integrate data from different sources (such as historical transaction data, market trends, supplier performance, etc.) and perform intelligent analysis on it. In the task research, this paper introduces two algorithms: one is the improved depth-first search algorithm (IDFS), which is used to optimize the path selection; The other is adaptive reinforcement Learning (AER) for real-time decision support. By combining these two algorithms, a new cooperative optimization algorithm (CAO) is generated, which shows significant performance improvement in solving real supply chain problems. The experimental results show that the proposed model has obvious advantages in shortening order fulfillment time, reducing operation cost and improving resource utilization, and provides a new idea for the intelligent transformation of supply chain management.

title: Alleviating Sub-Synchronous Oscillations In A DFIG-Based WPP Using a Damping Controller
authors: Jawaharlal Bhukya, Ajith mani Sai Aligati, Mohd Alam, Surender Kannaiyan
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Sub-synchronous Oscillations (SSO) is a critical issue in capacitive series-compensated transmission lines for Wind Power Plants (WPP), which enhance power transfer capabilities due to remote locations. These oscillations can significantly affect the stability and safety of WPP, especially in Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) systems. This paper explores DFIG WES and reviews traditional SSO mitigation techniques that use Proportional-Integral (PI) controllers. It also introduces a novel supplementary damping controller with rotor speed as its control input. Time-domain simulations evaluated the performance and limitations of these mitigation techniques. The analysis revealed a need for a more effective solution, leading to the application of a Particle Swarm Optimisation (PSO) algorithm to optimise the parameters of the controllers within a DFIG framework. Results from the optimized system show substantial improvement in SSO damping across various wind speeds and compensation levels, providing a more effective approach to SSO mitigation. The study uses the IEEE First Benchmark Model integrated with a DFIG-based WES to investigate these dynamics.

title: Assessing the capabilities of MBERT And Flan-T5 in detecting of multilingual suspicious messages
authors: Mohammed Akber Ali, M.S. Qaseem, Mohammed Mahmood Ali, Tamkanath Farooqui, Iram Fatima, Ayesha Mirza
publish: 2025 International Conference on Emerging Techniques in Computational Intelligence (ICETCI)
abstract: These days, the increasing prevalence of internet threats such as phishing, spam, dangerous intent, fraud, and other related threats have posed many risks to individuals and organizations across the world. Previous research in this scope primarily focused on rule-based or keyword-driven approaches, which were mostly limited to single-language datasets and lacked the adaptability required for multilingual contexts. The need of detecting these messages multilingually arises from the growing number of digital dangers. This paper explores the use of LLM (Large Language Models), for identifying potentially suspicious content across multiple language contexts. MBERT model utilizes a transformer-based bidirectional attention mechanism to extract the meaning of words in multilingual messages and offers reliable detection of risks across diverse languages. Flan-T5 is fine-tuned using a broad set of task-specific instructions, improving its performance on unseen tasks. Moreover, approaches like zero-shot learning allow the system to get used to work on/adapt to different languages, on which it is not trained. Both our models show promising results with synthetic multilingual datasets. The overall accuracies are 82.3% and 83.33% for MBERT and Flan T5 respectively. The results obtained are helpful in dealing with messages involving cyber threats.

title: Estimation of Target Vehicle Attitude Parameters from LiDaR Data for Defining Platform Stability in the Ego Vehicle
authors: Shubham Raul, G A Shanmugha Sundaram, Saksham Srivastava
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: The proposed work presents a technique to enhance the stability in the ego vehicle, that has advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) features deployed on board, from an estimation of the attitude parameters of target vehicles derived from LiDaR data measurements. The method addresses the important problem of crashes in the context of adverse road conditions when vehicles are part of a convoy, with adaptive cruise control (ACC) enabled as part of ADAS functionality. It uses LiDaR point cloud data (PCD) for tracking and detection of vehicles, and to estimate the attitude parameters (roll, pitch, yaw), and the longitudinal, lateral and rotational velocities in the scenario of sub-optimal terrain conditions. A VoxelNet algorithm for 3D object detection is used, followed by a Kalman filter for robust tracking. Attitude estimation is done by deriving the Eulerian attitude angles from a decomposition-based rotation matrix. Experimental results confirm the efficacy of this approach in different driving conditions associated with ACC, such as straight and turn sections of roads, and unevenly paved road conditions. The system exhibits robust real-time performance in tracking, detection and attitude estimation of vehicles, with potential improvements towards more robust ADAS use cases while also minimizing road accidents due to adverse road and driving conditions.

title: Research on identification method of market power of power generation enterprises based on multi-oligopoly game
authors: Jun Wang, Jialin Song, Ruohui Mo, Minglong Zou, Yongqi He
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: As the electricity market transitions from a traditional planned economy model to a market-oriented operation, the competition mechanisms, transaction rules, and regulatory systems are encountering significant challenges and opportunities. In particular, power generation companies serve as key players within this market, making the rational utilization of their market power and effective oversight especially critical. The current structure of the electricity market often reflects characteristics of oligopoly, with a limited number of large power generation companies dominating market supply. These companies wield considerable influence and authority due to their scale, capital, and technological advantages. However, such a market structure can also facilitate the potential abuse of market power, which can adversely affect fair competition and the optimal allocation of resources. This article aims to explore a method for identifying the market power of oligopolistic power generation enterprises through the lens of game theory. This method effectively assesses market entities by constructing a bidding strategy model tailored for power generation enterprises operating within a regional oligopoly, alongside an index system for identifying abusive market power behaviors. Ultimately, this approach seeks to accurately determine the extent of market power to foster fair competition and promote the healthy development of the power market.

title: Reduction of Torque ripple in SynRM Drive through Structural Modification and Control for EVs
authors: P Nikhila M, P Mini V
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: The efficient performance of an electric power train primarily depends on motors and their control. Currently, permanent magnet synchronous motors are the preferred choice for electric propulsion due to their high efficiency. In contrast, synchronous reluctance motors are constructed without rare earth permanent magnets, making them a cost-effective alternative for traction applications. However, synchronous reluctance motors experience significant torque ripple due to their anisotropic rotor structure and nonlinear magnetic characteristics. Structural modifications and advanced controllers are typically employed to mitigate torque ripple. This paper proposes different methods to reduce the torque ripple in synchronous reluctance motor drives. One approach involves modifying the rotor configuration to decrease the torque ripple within the motor itself. Another method consists of applying field-oriented control strategy and maximum torque per ampere with field-oriented control to the synchronous reluctance motor drive to minimize torque ripple. Simulation results indicate a substantial reduction in torque ripple. Overall, the proposed methods enhance the feasibility of synchronous reluctance motors for next-generation electric vehicle propulsion systems.

title: Multi-Channel Modular Platform Software for Hardware-in-the-Loop Testing of Trustworthy Smallsat Devices Units
authors: Anastasia M. Egorova, Alexander D. Surinovich, Ivan B. Leukhin, Alexey O. Shirin, Leonid N. Kessarinsky, Alexander Y. Nikiforov
abstract: This paper describes the applied approach of hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulation for testing blocks of smallsat (SSC) vehicles. It describes a software platform consisting of standard microservice libraries for functional blocks and measuring instruments. Enterprise standard for developing test plans, an operator's environment, and forming the final test program.

title: Design of a Low Phase Noise V-Band Vco Using Integrated Passives
authors: Ch Parvateeshwar Reddy, Sumedha Bugata, M Lakshmi Vardhan Reddy, T Bharath Chandra Reddy, Karthigha Balamurugan
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing, VLSI, Electrical Circuits and Robotics (DISCOVER)
abstract: This work presents the design of V-band LC tankbased Voltage Controlled Oscillator (VCO) using 65 nm CMOS technology. Two integrated passives such as on-chip octagonal inductor with ferrite core and 2:1 on-chip octagonal transformer have been designed with high quality factor performance and used for construction of LC resonator. This work reveals the optimal dimensions of the integrated passives that form the specific guidelines for its CMOS compatibility. Results show that the VCO with inductor-based resonator achieves a phase noise of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{- 8 6. 7 3 0} \text{dBc} / \text{Hz}$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-107.586 \text{dBc} / \text{Hz}$</tex> centered at 55.18 GHz while transformer-based VCO achieves <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-81.065 \text{dBc} / \text{Hz}$</tex> and -109.915 <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\text{dBc} / \text{Hz}$</tex> centered at 51.69 GHz, for at 1 MHz and 10 MHz offset respectively. Relevantly phase noise is improved by 6.77 % and 4.41 %. Comparative evaluation highlights the effectiveness of custom integrated passive components over the conventional inductors for VCO design.

title: A New Approach to Grid Tied Inverter Design Using Seven Level Topology
authors: Majji Sai Manohar, V Prasanth Kumar, P.K. Dhal
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: The current work introduces a single phase sevenlevel inverter with fewer switches. The suggested topology is compared to existing setups and its benefits are examined. Five power switches four MOSFETs and one diode provide a seven-level output in the intended system. Lowering the number of switches reduces Total Harmonic Distortion. The inverter reproduces the signals accurately using modified sinusoidal pulse width modulation (MSPWM) for inverter operation. The LC networks generate stepped waveforms at the output. Multiple load scenarios and operating frequencies are used to evaluate system performance. Complete performance analysis using MATLAB/Simulink. To test its performance in real time, the suggested inverter is connected to the grid.

title: Enhanced Isolation Hexagonal UWB MIMO Antenna for Next-Gen Wireless Communication
authors: Sravan Kumar Talusani, Prakasa Rao Amara
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: This work explores the design and performance evaluation of a miniature $2 \times 2$ hexagonal MIMO antenna optimized for use in ultra-wideband (UWB) systems. The geometry holds a dimension of 36 X $40 \times 1.6 \mathrm{~mm}^{3}$ with FR4 dielectric material used as substrate. The antenna features a hexagonal patch with a microstrip feed line with $50 \Omega$ impedance and changed ground configuration to enhance isolation. The antenna operates at a specific frequency is $\mathbf{4 . 8 4 ~ G H z}$ to 12.23 GHz. The return loss ($S_{11}, S_{22}$), radiation patterns, mutual coupling ($\mathbf{S}_{\mathbf{1 2}}, \mathbf{S}_{\mathbf{2 1}}$), gain, diversity performance for the evaluated antenna simulated in ANSYS HFSS. Additionally, it looks at the MIMO antenna system’s Diversity Gain, Envelope Correlation Coefficient and Total Active Reflection Coefficient. Suggested antenna offers good wide bandwidth, stable radiation patterns and minimal mutual coupling which is suitable for UWB systems.

title: Latency-Aware Mechanism for Deep Learning-Based Network Intrusion Detection
authors: Colum Chen, Michael Huang
publish: 2025 IEEE 12th International Conference on Cyber Security and Cloud Computing (CSCloud)
abstract: The application of deep learning models to network intrusion detection has seen success, achieving an average accuracy of over 95 percent. We evaluate the strengths and limitations of three dominant deep learning architectures: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), and Transformers. Despite impressive detection accuracy, latency and resource demands are barriers to realworld deployment. To address this, we propose a Latency-Aware Gated Cascade (LAGC) mechanism, which optimizes the accuracy and inference speed trade-off through a routing policy and a fusion strategy between CNN and Transformer models. On a synthetic dataset, the LAGC achieves 96.8% accuracy, close to the Transformer's 97.2 %, but with a much faster inference time of 0.42 ms, a 42 % reduction. The LAGC is significantly more accurate than the CNN's 91.8 %, while only being slower by 0.03 ms, showing a strong balance between accuracy and efficiency.

title: Mini-AlexNet: A Lightweight Object Detection Model
authors: Weitao Ren
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: In traffic scene object detection, edge devices are limited by storage and computing resources. Traditional AlexNet models suffer from parameter redundancy and high computational complexity, resulting in insufficient real-time performance and difficulty meeting deployment requirements. Among existing lightweight methods, static quantization easily causes feature distortion due to fixed thresholds, while random pruning may damage key feature channels. Neither can balance accuracy and efficiency. To address these issues, this paper proposes a lightweight model, Mini-AlexNet, based on quantization and pruning. The model achieves lightweight through collaborative optimization of dynamic quantization and structured pruning: Dynamic quantization adjusts quantization parameters (scaling factors and zeros) in real-time during inference, compressing 32-bit floating-point parameters into 8-bit integers to reduce storage requirements. Structured pruning screens redundant channels based on the gamma values of BN layers, removing filters with weak responses to non-critical features in traffic scenes (with a pruning ratio of 30%) while maintaining the consistency of residual connections to avoid topological damage. Experimental results show that the size of Mini-AlexNet is reduced to 39.5 MB (an 83.3% compression), computational complexity is decreased by $\mathbf{7 8. 2 \%} \boldsymbol{(} \mathbf{0. 3 1 G}$ FLOPs), and the frames per second (FPS) is increased to 11.2. Meanwhile, it maintains detection accuracy for core targets such as vehicles and pedestrians. Visualization results indicate more concentrated confidence and fewer redundant annotations. This research provides an efficient lightweight solution for real-time traffic object detection on edge devices, with practical deployment value.

title: A Contention-Aware Stacking-Based Domino Logic Design for Low Leakage Low Power Wide Fan-in Gates
authors: Dalvi Talukdar, Akho John Richa, Pranab Kishore Dutta
abstract: As technology has been scaled down day by day, VLSI design approaches a well performed device for modern applications with less chip area. The primary concern for this portable design is the power efficiency. Domino logic circuit is always used for a high performing device however the biggest challenge is the power consumption. In this paper, a novel design of low power domino logic circuit is introduced which helps to reduce the total power consumption of any modern application oriented portable device. The novel circuit is designed using the concept of contention current between PDN network and current of the keeper transistor. It also uses the stacking effect and a distinctive topology of keeper transistor design to mitigate the challenge of power consumption. The design is simulated and analyzed with 180 nm CMOS technology in tanner S-Edit using 1V power supply. The simulation result reveals a power reduction up to 99.04% as compared to the standard domino logic.

title: Emotion-Driven Innovative Design of Mobility Aids for Elderly in Rural Areas
authors: Xinhao Wang, Fei Fei, Fan Wu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Culture-Oriented Science &amp; Technology (CoST)
abstract: As China's population ages rapidly, the unique mobility needs of elderly individuals in rural areas, especially those who are among the oldest old, remain insufficiently addressed. Unlike urban seniors, rural elders often engage in productive labor, creating specific demands for mobility tools that current designs rarely meet. This study tackles this gap by proposing an innovative design approach driven by emotional needs. By employing a method with three stages, Evaluation Grid Method, Analytic Hierarchy Process, and Kansei evaluation, the research identifies key emotional and functional preferences, quantifies design priorities, and validates solutions through expert review. The result is a multifunctional mobility tool tailored to rural life and productive aging. This work contributes a closed loop, user centered methodology for mobility aid design and provides actionable insights for inclusive product development aligned with China's Rural Revitalization Strategy.

title: Transformer-based Sequential Contrastive Learning for Industrial Robot Time Series Anomaly Detection
authors: Zeying Wang, Danyang Wu, Jianyong Zhu
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: In modern industrial production, robots and intelligent equipment continuously generate massive time series data, making timely detection of anomalous patterns crucial for ensuring equipment safety and production efficiency. However, industrial scenarios face challenges including scarcity of anomalous samples, diverse and complex anomaly patterns, and strict real-time requirements, while existing deep learning methods still exhibit limitations in handling long-range dependencies and parallel computation. To address these challenges, this paper proposes TOCA (Transformer-Based Contrastive One-Class Time Series Anomaly Detection), a Transformer-based sequential contrastive learning model. The model innovatively integrates Transformers into the sequential contrastive learning framework, employing a multi-layer convolutional feature encoder to extract original representations, utilizing Transformer networks to model global dependencies for generating reconstructed representations, and designing a sequential contrastive learning module to achieve negative-sample-free contrastive learning. Experimental results demonstrate that TOCA achieves RPA F1 scores of 41.67% and 57.55% on IOpsCompetition and UCR datasets respectively, and 65.27% on real industrial robot datasets, significantly outperforming existing baseline models and validating the model’s effectiveness and practicality in industrial anomaly detection tasks.

title: HBM-YOLO: Multi-Scale Enhanced YOLO with Hierarchical Group Convolution and Bi-Level Routing Attention for Small Object Detection in UAV Imagery
authors: Tao Wang, Liyang Yu, Jing Ning
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: Unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) target detection faces critical challenges in identifying small, dense targets within complex aerial environments. The current YOLO architecture has problems with extracting features at different scales, using dynamic attention mechanisms, and combining features in a way that adapts to the needs of unmanned aerial vehicles. This paper introduces HBM-YOLO, an improved detection framework that solves these problems with three new architectural ideas that work together. The hierarchical grouping enhancement C3k2 (HGE_C3k2) module uses multi-scale convolution and smart channel partitioning instead of the standard C3k2 component to better capture different spatial patterns. Second, the convolutional Double-layer Routing Attention (C2BRA) mechanism takes the place of the C2PSA component. It adds hierarchical attention paths so that selective feature aggregation can happen in the top-k region while using less computing power. Third, the Hybrid Aggregation Network (MANet) takes the place of the C3k2 module in the detection head. It does this by using multipath processing and residual refinement to adaptively fuse features. Comprehensive tests on VisDrone-DET2019 showed that HBMYOLO did very well: mAP @ 0.5 reached 35.4%, and $\mathrm{mAP} \text{@} 0.5: 0.95$ reached 20.7%. These were 2.2% and 1.4% higher than the baseline YOLOv11n, respectively. This framework has set a new standard for finding targets with unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). It solves problems like changes in scale, limited computing power, and how to represent features in real-time aerial environments.

title: Animal Track Detection and Classification Using Vision-Based Deep Models
authors: Prathyakshini, Prathwini, Disha S Rao, Vaishnavi Kundeshwara Bhat
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing, VLSI, Electrical Circuits and Robotics (DISCOVER)
abstract: Animal footprint identification is an essential technique for environmental preservation, conservation, and wildlife monitoring. This research demonstrates a deep learning-based approach to identify and categorize the footprints of several animal species, including raccoons, dogs, horses, bears, and rats. This technique uses strong CNNs with deep learning architectures to extract the characteristics of an animal's footprints. To make the system robust to a variety of real-world scenarios, training is done using a tagged and preprocessed image dataset. The challenging problems of size, angle, and illumination fluctuations are then addressed by applying a range of picture augmentation techniques to the images. A web application is created that makes the system user-friendly and accessible by allowing the user to enter footprint images that the trained model will recognize instantly. The model's train and validation accuracies are 96.57% and 93.59%, respectively. This research provides researchers, environmentalists, and wildlife enthusiasts with an efficient, non- invasive method to monitor animal populations, study migration patterns, and enhance wildlife conservation efforts.

title: Malware Analysis Using Machine Learning Algorithms
authors: Tanzila Nargis, Sharada U Shenoy, Suhail Ahamed Nisar Shaha, Navya Rao, Prajna Pai, Prarthana M Kunder
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing, VLSI, Electrical Circuits and Robotics (DISCOVER)
abstract: As the digital landscape evolves, the proliferation of intricate malware strains poses an escalating threat to computer systems. Traditional signature-based detection methods prove insufficient in the face of this surge in malware diversity. Recognizing the limitations, this study explores the efficacy of machine learning for malware detection and classification. The proposed approach involves leveraging the dynamic analysis capabilities of the cuckoo sandbox, which executes malware within a controlled environment, yielding an insightful analysis report based on system activities during execution. The experimental results underscore the success of the approach. Notably, the framework achieves heightened accuracy in both detection and classification when compared to prevailing state-of-the-art methodologies. The experiment includes twelve different machine learning algorithms which performs the detection and classification of the malware. The analysis proves that the ensemble machine learning models perform good in detecting the malware with an accuracy of 95.98% and 40-50% accuracy in classifying it to the particular malware family. This innovative combination of dynamic analysis, feature selection, and machine learning models offers a robust solution to the contemporary challenges posed by sophisticated malware threats, contributing to the advancement of cybersecurity measures.

title: Research on Intelligent Recommendation System Model in Tourism Management Teaching Reform
authors: Nan Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: This study is dedicated to designing an intelligent recommendation system model to promote the teaching reform of tourism management. After in-depth analysis of the characteristics and needs of tourism management teaching, a system architecture covering modules such as data collection, user and course resource modeling, and recommendation engine is constructed. A recommendation algorithm based on tourism knowledge graph and reinforcement learning is creatively proposed. This algorithm enriches the semantic information representation state with the help of knowledge graph, carefully designs the action space and reward function, and continuously optimizes the recommendation process based on user feedback. The experiment is carried out based on the construction platform, using real data sets related to tourism management teaching in many universities, and using traditional collaborative filtering algorithms and content-based recommendation algorithms as controls. Experimental data show that the accuracy of recommendation of this algorithm is 0.85, the recall value is 0.82, and the F1-score is 0.83, which is far higher than the control algorithm; the diversity index is improved by 20%, and the novelty index is improved by 15%. The user satisfaction survey shows that 88% of students are satisfied with the recommendation results. The study shows that the intelligent recommendation system model can effectively improve the quality of tourism management teaching resource recommendation and strongly support teaching reform.

title: Optimizing EV Battery Cooling: Air vs Liquid Strategies with 3D Experience Dymola
authors: Ahmed, K. S. Sujatha, Sanjiba Kumar Bisoyi, Asha Somashekharayya Balikai
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: This research provides a thorough comparison of air and liquid cooling techniques intended for managing thermal conditions in battery packs, crucial for improving performance and ensuring safe functionality in electric vehicles and related energy storage systems. Employing a systematic phased approach, the temperature patterns associated with both cooling methods were examined. Subsequently, an extensive modeling of the air and liquid cooling system was completed and then incorporated with a battery circuit created for Energetic Dimensioning. This integration emphasized the improved thermal management efficiencies found in both cooling systems. The implications of these findings extend to the creation of efficient thermal management systems in electric vehicles and other battery-dependent applications, thus significantly aiding advancements in sustainable transportation and energy storage technologies.

title: A Novel VLC Positioning Method Upon Retroreflective OIRS-Assisted Optical Communications
authors: Yulin Wang, Xiping Wu, Cheng-Xiang Wang, Gan Zheng, Tianhua Xu
abstract: An indoor visible light communication (VLC) positioning system is proposed to address line-of-sight (LoS) blockage in complex environments. The system integrates optical intelligent reflecting surfaces (OIRSs) with retroreflectors to form a bidirectional light path: LED to OIRS, then to the retroreflector, and back, enabling reliable localization under nonline-of-sight (NLoS) conditions. A hierarchical search algorithm is employed for the optimal estimation of the OIRS orientation, followed by a K-nearest neighbor (KNN) based fingerprinting method for position inference. Simulation results demonstrate centimeter-level positioning accuracy. The comparative analysis further indicates that the use of retroreflectors not only improves robustness but also significantly reduces the number of required OIRS units compared to conventional OIRS-only systems.

title: Multi-dimensional collaborative recommendation model based on implicit trust network
authors: Chuang Zhang, Yuzhi Xiao, Chao Lei, Meng Cheng
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: Personalized recommendation models are often constrained by data sparsity and model complexity, which limits the discovery of users’ latent preferences. To address this issue, a multi-dimensional collaborative recommendation model based on an implicit trust network is proposed. Multi-dimensional user profiles are constructed by integrating user attributes and spatial-geographical features. Preference correlations between users are quantified using cosine similarity, and significantly correlated nodes are identified through dynamic thresholding to construct an implicit trust network based on potential preferences. The Louvain algorithm is then employed to perform hierarchical community partitioning of the implicit trust network, where the modularity index is iteratively optimized to form highly cohesive sub-communities, thereby reducing the temporal and spatial complexity of global similarity computation. Within each sub-community, a temporal penalty mechanism and an item popularity penalty term are further incorporated to suppress popularity bias and improve robustness. Experimental results on the MovieLens 1 M dataset indicate that the proposed model significantly outperforms baseline methods in terms of MAE, RMSE, accuracy, recall, and $\mathbf{F 1}$ score, thereby demonstrating its effectiveness.

title: Cyber Physical Digital Twin for Energy Monitoring and Control using Intelligent Smart Meter Network
authors: Gayathri S, Monisha M, Anant Kumar, Murari Kumar, Neha Gupta, K S Swarup
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: In the era of intelligent power system, the present work pioneers a next generation of reshaping power systems. As energy landscape evolves the synergy of AI and IoT is redefining smart metering and intelligent techniques in grid operation. An experimental prototype is designed to enable real time edge intelligence and predictive decision-making grid analysis at the grid edge by reducing latency and enhancing efficiency and security. By embedding AI at smart meter level, we transform raw data into actionable insights by optimizing load forecasting and demand response in the system. By harnessing these techniques, the system ensures a robust synthetic data augmentation and resilience monitoring ensuring the better performance of the system. This hardware centric innovation serves as the foundation of an envisioned Cyber-Physical System architecture where real time virtualization which revolutionize the power system management. This fusion of physical and digital intelligence marks a transformative leap towards the autonomous, resilience by unlocking unprecedented level of efficiency, security and intelligence in future power system networks.

title: Forecasting Solar PV Performance During Wildfire Events: A Hybrid Statistical and Artificial Neural Network Approach
authors: Seungjin Lee, Alfredo A. Martinez-Morales, Michael Todd, Rohini Raghunathan, Nagendra Cherukupalli, Jonathan O’Neill Hewlett, Miroslav Penchev
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Solar photovoltaic systems face significant challenges during wildfire events due to reduced solar irradiance and increased particulate deposition, which can severely impact their performance. This study explores the effects of wildfire-induced soiling on solar energy output using a combined modeling approach. Linear regression is used to establish baseline relationships, while an artificial neural network model is used to enhance prediction accuracy by addressing nonlinear environmental effects. Data collected during a 51-day study period, including a 7-day wildfire-affected period, are analyzed to evaluate the regression and neural network models' performance under varying environmental conditions. Results show that the artificial neural network model consistently achieves lower prediction errors and higher accuracy compared to regression alone, particularly during wildfire periods where environmental variability is highest. The findings demonstrate the importance of addressing soiling and dynamic environmental factors in photovoltaic performance forecasting. This research provides valuable insights for improving the reliability of solar power systems in regions prone to extreme weather events, supporting energy resilience in wildfire-prone regions.

title: Consistent Perspective Alignment in Multiuser Mixed Reality for Collaborative Surgical Pre-Planning
authors: Megha Manoj Menon, Uma Gopalakrishnan, Mahesh Kappanayil, Saurav Prabhakaran
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: Traditional pre-operative planning, relying on 2D medical images, struggles to convey the spatial complexities of anatomy, hindering surgical precision. Mixed Reality offers an interactive space that combines physical and digital spaces together. This paper describes a mixed reality application aimed at enhancing surgical preplanning by offering a fast and reliable framework for visualizing patient anatomies for medical professionals. The application enables multiple users to interact with a 3D anatomical model in a collaborative setup. Users can manipulate the 3D model through intuitive hand gestures (scaling, rotation, and translation), ensuring that all collaborators share a consistent view of the model’s transformations in both time and space. The application is developed for Microsoft Hololens 2, using Unity, Vuforia, and the Mixed Reality Toolkit, it relies on marker-based tracking for the precise registration of 3D anatomical models in the real-world environment. The application creates an immersive and interactive environment for the user to gain a better understanding of the complex anatomical structures. The reliability of marker-based tracking was evaluated by measuring translation error, rotation error, and the latency between marker recognition and model deployment. A negligible delay of less than 0.05 seconds was observed for the model to achieve a state of zero translation and rotation error. The results reveal that marker-based tracking has the potential to ensure consistency in the deployment of models during surgical planning and decision-making workflows.

title: Evaluating the Benefits of Zero-Emission Vehicles Adoption for California-Mexico Cross Border Freight
authors: Miroslav Penchev, Tahir Cetin Akinci, Alfredo A. Martinez-Morales, Michael Todd, Arun S.K. Raju
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Establishing zero-emission vehicle (ZEV) infrastructure is essential for maintaining trade and improving environmental quality at the border. The present study introduces a methodology for estimating vehicle miles traveled (VMT) by cross-border freight trucks in San Diego County and the corresponding environmental implications, specifically regarding tailpipe exhaust emissions across various parts of the county. This study forecasts the growth of cross-border freight vehicle VMT until 2050 and the VMT associated with future medium and MHD ZEV deployments. Furthermore, this work forecasts the electric energy and hydrogen fuel required to operate future commercial MHD ZEVs. Finally, the requisite number of EV charging stations and hydrogen fueling stations for establishing the MHD ZEV infrastructure along the California-Baja California border is estimated, based on current charging and fueling specifications.

title: A Comprehensive Survey on Depression Detection Through Social Media Using Machine Learning and NLP Techniques
authors: Ranganatha K, Laxmi B. Rananavare
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing, VLSI, Electrical Circuits and Robotics (DISCOVER)
abstract: Depression is an enormous worldwide mental illness challenge that impacts tens of millions of individuals in their daily activities. As social media becomes a way of life, Digital interactions on social media have become fertile grounds for observing emotional patterns and behavioral inclinations. Here, scientists are increasingly applying machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques to identify symptoms of depression from social media posts. This paper provides an exhaustive review of such strategies, discussing their value in promoting mental health research. It discusses the application of deep learning, sentiment analysis, and data-oriented approaches on various datasets, emphasizing their advantages and disadvantages. The research also assesses prevailing models and performance measures, highlighting computational complexity, data privacy, and lack of generalizability as issues. Through an identification of the main gaps in prevailing methods, this survey offers guidance for building more robust, ethical, and interpretable systems for detecting depression.

title: Test Prioritization for Compressed Image Classification Models
authors: Yunfei Jia, Xu Zhou
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: Compression models have gained popularity in recent years as method of increasing the efficiency of deep neural networks (DNNs) deployed on edge devices. However, the compression process may increase misclassification risks and impair model accuracy. As a result, how to efficiently find and rectify faults in compressed models with limited resources has become an essential topic that must be addressed. This study provides a test prioritization strategy for compressed classification models with the goal of prioritizing the discovery of test samples that are more likely to be misclassified by compressed models, hence enhancing model performance while reducing overall label costs. To capture the behavioral shifts caused by compression, this method initially constructs intrinsic attributes based on the prediction disparities between the compressed model and the original model, as well as the embedded features of the input instances. A graph neural network is subsequently introduced to derive the neighborhood structural features of each test sample, reflecting its structural association with known error samples in the feature space, by constructing a similarity graph between training data and test data. Ultimately, the two kinds of features are combined, and a neural network is employed to forecast the misclassification probability of the test samples, thereby achieving ranking. Empirical research indicates that the method outlined in this paper can significantly enhance the accuracy and adversarial robustness of compressed models following retraining with restricted samples, and it surpasses the performance of current general test ranking methods. The results substantiate the potential of compressed model test ranking methods to enhance model performance and decrease the cost of manual annotation.

title: Multi-Objective Particle Swarm Optimization for Demand Response Strategy in Industrial Cooling Loads within Smart Grids
authors: Mengyu Wang, Zhaonan Zhou, Zige Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: This paper studies the power demand response optimization strategy of industrial cooling systems in the smart grid environment. Based on the flexible properties of cooling load operation, a multi-objective optimization model with operating cost, peak load and comfort as the objectives is constructed. Then, a scheduling mechanism is designed based on the multi-objective particle swarm optimization algorithm (MOPSO) to achieve intelligent control of industrial loads. Through simulation experiments based on the ComStock ™ data set, this method can greatly reduce electricity expenditure and peak load while ensuring the temperature control accuracy of the system. The optimization strategy achieves a cost reduction of about 5.3% in typical load scenarios, and also controls the temperature control deviation within ±1.2°C. The adaptability and stability of the model in multi-objective scheduling are verified. The constructed MOPSO optimization framework shows strong engineering deployability, which has found a feasible way to promote the deep involvement of industrial loads in demand-side management.

title: Multilingual Comparative Study of Query Performance: Relational Vs Non-Relational Databases on Indian Languages
authors: Solaimurugan Vellaipandiyan, D Ethirajan, Blessy Thomas, Vipin Kumar Singh
abstract: In the era of globalization and digital transformation, the need for database management systems that support diverse languages and provide robust performance across varied use cases has become increasingly paramount. This study provides an in-depth technical performance analysis of three leading database systems—PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MongoDB—evaluating their efficiency in executing insert, select, and delete operations on queries written in ten Indian languages: English, Hindi, Telugu, Marathi, Kannada, Odia, Bengali, Malayalam, Urdu, and Tamil. The experiments were conducted on datasets of varying sizes: 1,000, 10,000, and 100,000 records across an on-premises environment. The study utilizes a structured approach, analyzing the mean execution time and query throughput for each database system. A detailed comparison highlights the advantages of schema-based relational models (PostgreSQL and MySQL) versus the flexibility and horizontal scalability of the schema-less NoSQL model (MongoDB).

title: Contemporary Directions in Cybersecurity Avionics Risk Analysis
authors: Erik Blasch, Victor Murray, Mario Werthwein, Jeffrey S. Chavis, Jan Leuchter, Aloke Roy, James Lyke, Carlos C. Insaurralde, Giancarmine Fasano
publish: 2025 AIAA DATC/IEEE 44th Digital Avionics Systems Conference (DASC)
abstract: With the increase in the congested airspace that incorporates signals, commands, and policies aggregated over multi-domain operations, cybersecurity risk is increasing. In this paper, the IEEE AESS Cyber Avionics Security Panel highlights contemporary methods discussed in aviation cybersecurity. As focused on the awareness and risk, the paper identifies directions for(1) next generation threats in aerospace cybersecurity, (2) artificial intelligence and machine learning in support or aerospace cyber defense including large language models, (3) applying zero trust and blockchains to avionics, (4) advanced edge computing implications to avionics cybersecurity, (5) cybersecurity in air and space traffic management (A-STM), including securing the internet of things (IoT) as a sensor in the airspace infrastructure, and (6) methods of cyber-security risk analysis that includes hardware, software, and data. Three focused advances include discussions on large language models (LLMs), zero-trust policies, and risk scoring.

title: Are Vision-Language Foundation Models Able to Fly?
authors: Joachim Rüter, Philipp Davydov, Theresa Maienschein, Umut Durak, Johann C. Dauer
publish: 2025 AIAA DATC/IEEE 44th Digital Avionics Systems Conference (DASC)
abstract: Safe autonomous aircraft require accurate environment perception, which can be achieved through semantic segmentation of camera images. However, training neural networks relies on large, diverse datasets that are often unavailable in aviation. Vision-language foundation models offer a promising alternative, but their accuracy for aviation tasks is an open question as the aerial perspective might not be adequately represented in the original training data. Against this background, this paper investigates the performance of two vision-language foundation models, CLIPSeg and CAT-Seg, on an aerial image dataset. Our experiments show that the models can achieve competitive semantic segmentation performance without aviation-specific training. This paper further examines prompt engineering and discusses challenges of deploying these models in aviation. While certification and runtime constraints pose significant hurdles, our findings suggest that vision-language foundation models have potential for improving environment perception in aviation and may reduce the need for extensive training data in the future.

title: GRU-Powered Cloud Framework for Advanced Analytics of lithium iron phosphate Cell
authors: Balram Kasniya, Tirupathiraju Kanumuri, Vivek Shrivastava
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Lithium iron phosphate (LiFePO) batteries are extensively utilized in applications such as electric vehicles, energy storage systems, and portable electronics, owing to their superior energy density, thermal stability, and extended cycle lifespan. Efficient and accurate real-time monitoring and analysis of lithium iron phosphate cells is crucial for ensuring safety, improving performance, and extending lifespan. This paper proposes a novel Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs)-powered cloud framework to analyze battery performance parameters, including state of health (SOH), thermal behavior, and internal resistance, leveraging large-scale lithium iron phosphate battery experimental datasets. The framework integrates a gated recurrent unit (GRU) model for time-series predictions, a cloud-based architecture for computational scalability, and advanced data processing pipelines for extracting critical battery parameters. Experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in prediction accuracy, computational efficiency, and scalability compared to traditional methods.

title: Research on Noise Suppression Technology of Digital Audio Power Amplifier Based on Neural Network
authors: Moujun Li, Yu Guan, Botao Yu, Shiqi Hu
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Sensors, Electronics and Computer Engineering (ICSECE)
abstract: In small-scale venues such as conference rooms and training classrooms, audio systems are often disturbed by background noises like air conditioning, page turning, and coughing, which significantly affect speech clarity and system stability. To address these issues, this study proposes a noise suppression solution for digital audio power amplifiers based on neural networks. A lightweight convolutional neural network architecture is employed to perform real-time analysis and noise recognition on live audio signals. The system uses an optimized denoising algorithm to effectively eliminate environmental interference. Furthermore, a signal level-based switching mechanism enables seamless transition between analog and digital audio inputs, ensuring continuous playback and enhanced system reliability. The proposed solution has been validated in real-world applications, demonstrating not only improved audio clarity but also reduced maintenance complexity, making it highly applicable for broader deployment.

title: A Review on Recent Trends in AI-Based Fault Detection for Induction Machines in Automotive Applications
authors: Neethi S. Pillai, Sumit K. Chattopadhyay
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: Induction machines are increasingly being adopted for automotive applications as a competitive alternative to permanent magnet motors, emphasizing the need for reliable and safe operation. The significance of online condition monitoring is driven by the challenges posed by motor faults, which can result in significant downtime, maintenance costs, and revenue losses. However, a major obstacle in fault detection is the absence of an accurate analytical model to characterize faulty motors. With the growing integration of artificial intelligence (AI) across various industries, AI-based techniques have emerged as powerful tools for improving electric motor performance, particularly in fault detection and diagnosis. This paper provides a comprehensive review of recent trends of AI applications in induction machine drive, with a specific focus on early fault detection for automotive applications.

title:
Numerical Performance Analysis of BaZrS
                    <sub>3</sub>
                    -Based MSM Vertical Photodetector
authors: Shadi Yasin, Ziad Abu Waar, Stavros Christopoulos, Mohamed Moustafa
abstract: This study presents a comprehensive numerical modeling and performance evaluation of a BaZrS<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">3</inf>, perovskite-based, metal-semiconductor-metal (MSM) photodetector using SCAPS-1D, demonstrating its strong potential for high-efficiency photosensing applications. By systematically optimizing the absorber layer's thickness and doping concentration, notable enhancements in responsivity and detectivity were achieved. Under 600 nm irradiation, the photodetector exhibits an impressive responsivity of 0.41 A/W and a high detectivity of 9.87 × 10<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">15</sup> Jones. These findings establish BaZrS<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">3</inf> photo detectors as a promising, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly alternative for next-generation optoelectronic and sensing technologies.

title: Deep Residual Learning for Breast Cancer Diagnosis: A Modified ResNet-53 Approach
authors: Davinder Paul Singh, Dev Patel, Kathan Vyas, Pawandeep Kour, Shubham Mahajan, Debabrata Swain
abstract: Breast cancer continues to be a major cause of death for women globally, as early diagnosis greatly enhances chances of survival. This study introduces a new hybrid method for breast cancer detection using a Modified ResNet-53 architecture applied to mammogram images from CBIS-DDSM and INbreast datasets. Our model incorporates residual connections with enhancements including Global Average Pooling, batch normalization, and data augmentation techniques to address challenges specific to medical imaging. The proposed architecture achieves exceptional performance with 99.43% accuracy on CBIS-DDSM and 99.24% on INbreast datasets, outperforming traditional models like VGG16 and MobileNetV2. Comprehensive evaluation metrics including ROC-AUC scores above 0.97 demonstrate the model’s robustness in distinguishing benign and malignant cases with minimal false positives/negatives. The results validate the effectiveness of deep residual networks for medical image classification and highlight their potential for clinical decision support systems.

title: Explainable Multi-Modal Deep Learning Framework for Enhancing Cyber-Physical Systems Security
authors: Srikanta Datta Tumkur, Jay Iyer, Sanjay Babu Kurra
publish: 2025 IEEE 12th International Conference on Cyber Security and Cloud Computing (CSCloud)
abstract: Cyber-physical systems (CPS) combine sensing, control, and communication for automated operation across industrial domains. The increasing integration of these systems has introduced vulnerabilities that demand secure and explainable protection mechanisms. This work presents an explainable multi-modal deep learning framework for CPS intrusion detection. The model integrates temporal and contextual signals from HAI, ICS Process, and MQTT-IoT-IDS2020 datasets, achieving 99.96 % accuracy and 99.92% F1-score. LIME-based interpretation provides transparent reasoning for detected anomalies, while optimized fusion and encoding modules enhance computational efficiency. Experimental outcomes show that the framework delivers reliable, interpretable, and scalable security suitable for real-time CPS environments.

title: FPGA Implementation of Efficient Multiplier for an Image Processing Applications
authors: Parakoti Venkata Naga Sai Ganesh, Sanjeev Mani Yadav, Saswat Kumar Ram
publish: 2025 IEEE 6th India Council International Subsections Conference (INDISCON)
abstract: This paper presents an energy-efficient multiplier architecture optimized for image processing applications. The proposed design modifies the traditional $4: 2$ compressor within the partial product reduction stage to improve performance and reduce complexity. By introducing a new compressor structure, the multiplier achieves significant reductions in area, power consumption, and delay. The architecture was implemented and validated on an FPGA platform, demonstrating its practical effectiveness in real-time image multiplication tasks. Experimental results confirm that the proposed design offers substantial improvements in resource utilization and speed, making it a strong candidate for low-power, high-performance computing systems in error-resilient domains, proposed design has area efficient of $18 \%$ and power efficient of $5 \%$.

title: Optimal Planning of Sustainable Charging Infrastructure for Electric Vehicles in Coupled Transportation and Power Distribution Networks
authors: Digambar Singh Govind, Manoj Fozdar, Vikram Singh
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: The growing adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) is essential for promoting sustainable transportation. However, it presents significant challenges in determining the optimal placement of fast charging stations (FCS) within the transportation network, ensuring efficient EV charging while managing limited availability. However, it presents significant challenges in determining the optimal placement of fast charging stations (FCS) within the transportation network, ensuring efficient EV charging while managing limited available resources. FCS is associated with many uncertainties related to the planning of locations and sizing. In the proposed work, the transportation model is coordinated with the 33 bus standard test distribution system, which is considered in finding the optimal location of FCS on available routes. The spatial-temporal distribution of vehicles is considered to help in predicting the vehicle flow in the transportation model. In the optimal planning of fast charging stations, load predictions on available routes have a critical role in the transportation system. In fulfilment of the peak load demand at FCS, A mathematical model for a hybrid PV-battery system integrated with the FCS is developed to reduce distribution network stress and improve operator net savings.

title: Step-size Selection Strategy Network for Adaptive Interference Cancellation
authors: Zihan Li, Mingqiang Li, Jianjun Ge, Kai Guan, Xuchao Gao, Kuoye Han
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Computer and Information Processing Technology (ISCIPT)
abstract: Interference cancellation is an effective method for radar anti-mainlobe interference in today’s complex electromagnetic environment. However, the fast iteration of adaptive filtering algorithms in non-stationary environments within interference cancellation methods depends on the step size selection in optimization algorithms. To address this issue, this paper proposes a neural network-based adaptive step size selection method, and constructs a Chebyshev polynomial-based policy network pre-training method as well as a PPO-based reinforcement learning training method. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method has faster convergence compared to traditional step size selection methods and achieves better cancellation performance.

title: Optimization of Hydrogen Production Plant Allocation Using Particle Swarm Optimization for Cost-Effective Hydrogen Supply Networks
authors: Rawan A. Abdelsalam, Andrei Sleptchenko, Ahmad Mayyas, Toufic Mezher
publish: 2025 IEEE 5th International Conference on Sustainable Energy and Future Electric Transportation (SEFET)
abstract: The transition to clean energy positions hydrogen as a key solution for decarbonizing transportation, industry, and power sectors. This study optimizes hydrogen supply chains by allocating hydrogen production plants to 12 fueling stations in France. The problem is formulated as a mixed-integer nonlinear programming (MINLP) model with constraints on plant capacity, station demand, and transportation costs. Three solvers—Gurobi, Scipy, and Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO)—are compared. While Gurobi produces a suboptimal solution due to the non-convex nature of the problem, Scipy and PSO obtained nearoptimal solutions with significantly lower costs compared to Gurobi. However, Scipy struggles with multi-plant allocation scenarios. PSO is therefore selected for its scalability and robust performance. The study examines three scenarios with two, three, and four production plants to minimize total costs. The results show that deploying four plants achieves the lowest cost of $138 million by reducing transportation distances and balancing installation expenses. Future work will explore dynamic plant allocation, real-time demand integration, and uncertainty modeling to enhance scalability and practical applicability.

title: Lithium-Containing Raw Materials: Key Drivers Shaping the New Energy System Development
authors: Lan Liu, Xin Wang, Zegao Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Manipulation, Manufacturing and Measurement on the Nanoscale (3M-NANO)
